page.title: 14Today's Schools.
page.content: Most schools operate for about 7 hours per day; usually from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. (3.30 p.m. in the case of primary schools). Religious assembly is still compulsory by Act of Parliament and this usually starts off the day. Assembly is also found to be very useful for dealing with administration such as time_table changes. The day is then divided up into 7 or 8 periods by decision of the Head Master and teaching staff. There is usually a morning and afternoon break of l5 minutes and a lunch break of just over an hour. Many schools still insist on a school uniform as this is seen as blurring the difference between rich and poor. The school year is divided into 3 terms with a 6 week summer holiday.
